conclusion: Analyzing shadow changes when light source moves right
Object 1: A cake/pie with red topping (casting shadow A)
Object 2: A small cylindrical object with a postcard (casting shadow B)
Object 3: A rolled-up object, possibly a towel or mat (casting shadow C)
Object 4: A soccer ball (casting shadow D)
Physics of shadow formation: shadows move opposite to light source and change size based on angle
Shadow A will move further left and might become slightly smaller
Shadow B will shift more to the left and likely become shorter
Shadow C will shift more to the left and potentially become more elongated
Shadow D will move to the left and become smaller
Final answer: All shadows will move to the left and likely become smaller/shorter
